column4: Google success in U.S. schools forces Microsoft  Apple to scramble
column5: SAN FRANCISCO Microsoft Corp's announcement of a suite of new education products on Tuesday shows the company's determination to reverse a major shift that has taken place in U.S. classrooms in recent years: for most educators and school districts  Google's Chromebook is now the computer of choice. | Video

column4: RPT-Google success in U.S. schools forces Microsoft  Apple to scramble
column5: SAN FRANCISCO  May 2 Microsoft Corp's announcement of a suite of new education products on Tuesday shows the company's determination to reverse a major shift that has taken place in U.S. classrooms in recent years: for most educators and school districts  Google's Chromebook is now the computer of choice.

column4: UPDATE 3-Tesla plugs older Model S as new buyers turn to Model 3
column5: SAN FRANCISCO  May 3 Electric-car maker Tesla Inc on Wednesday reported first-quarter revenue that more than doubled  and while saying the upcoming Model 3 was on schedule for July  it downplayed the mass-market vehicle to give a sales pitch for its more expensive Model S.

NEW YORK (Reuters Breakingviews) - Tesla is demonstrating how its electric cars can generate valuation staying power. Chief Executive Elon Musk oversaw a loss that missed Wall Street expectations by a country mile  even as the top line clocked in ahead of forecasts. More importantly  he's vowing that annual Model 3 production alone can meet the company’s full target by the end of next year.

column4: Tesla's revenue more than doubles  helped by record deliveries
column5: May 3 Electric-car maker Tesla Inc reported quarterly revenue that more than doubled  driven by record deliveries of its Model X sports utility vehicles and Model S sedans.

column4: Einhorn  nursing losses on Tesla  says investors 'hypnotized' by Musk
column5: NEW YORK Hedge fund manager David Einhorn said on Wednesday that investors remain charmed by Tesla Inc Chief Executive Elon Musk  boosting the stock by 30 percent in the first quarter  even though the electric car maker's performance did not justify such gains.
